elements.title: The Wai (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the newly opened shopping mall The Wai has Hong Kong's largest indoor bicycle parking lot (pictured)?

elements.title: Djanius Djamin (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Djanius Djamin, the speaker of Medan's city council from 1969 to 1971, was the first woman to chair a legislature in Sumatra?

elements.title: Long Island's PBS station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Long Island's PBS station specialized in making shows for other stations to air during their pledge drives?

elements.title: Code of Lipit-Ishtar (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Code of Lipit-Ishtar is older than the famous Code of Hammurabi?

elements.title: Ralph "Catfish" Smith (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that American football player Ralph "Catfish" Smith was a two-way player in college and in the National Football League?

elements.title: Donald A. Morgan (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Donald A. Morgan is the first director of photography to be inducted into the Television Hall of Fame?

elements.title: Hay War Memorial High School (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Lord Stonehaven, Governor-General of Australia, called Hay War Memorial High School the "finest war memorial in the British Empire"?

elements.title: organisms could harvest kinetic energy (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that organisms could harvest kinetic energy to survive?
